image.altText: Dr Megan Brooks has a hand raised as she speaks during a parliamentary committee

props.synopsis: Speaking under parliamentary privilege, the testimony of emergency physician Megan Brooks was a rare public window into a health system under constant pressure, writes Leah MacLennan.

title.children: Doctor initially silenced at inquest gives inside look at ramping crisis

image.altText: A truck next to a power pole.

props.synopsis: More than 26,000 homes and businesses were left without electricity on Friday, some of them for more than 16 hours, when a fault at a substation cut supply to the Yorke Peninsula and parts of the Mid North.

title.children: Power back on for most in Yorke Peninsula after lengthy outage

image.altText: A man stood on rocks on the edge of the ocean

props.synopsis: A blast of hot northerly winds from Australia's interior will send temperatures up to 15 degrees Celsius above average across south-east states this weekend.

title.children: Gusty thundery change to follow near-record autumn heat

image.altText: A woman wearing a green shirt and apron sniffs a small blue container

props.synopsis: Olive oil producers and judges want Australians to get more familiar with the different flavours of the pantry staple.

title.children: Tasting room helps consumers detect different flavours in olive oil

image.altText: Image of three dogs on a rock

props.synopsis: A team on Kangaroo Island is making a final push to eradicate feral cats using specially trained hounds and high-tech traps.

title.children: How three dogs could help Kangaroo Island eliminate feral cats

image.altText: Nine players in whites and red caps hug and celebrate on a green field.

props.synopsis: Cricket Australia has confirmed the Sheffield Shield final will not be played at Adelaide Oval, saying on its website the AFL had blocked use of the iconic venue.

title.children: AFL 'blocks' Cricket Australia's bid to play Sheffield Shield final at Adelaide Oval

image.altText: Football players clash on field.

props.synopsis: State football leagues like the SANFL, which is already enjoying growing audiences, have a chance to draw in new audiences by broadcasting free-to-air games on Saturday now that the AFL is not.

title.children: State leagues to fill gap as AFL cuts free Saturday footy TV broadcasts

image.altText: Trees along a riverbank.

props.synopsis: As one end of the country contends with the fallout from ex-Tropical Cyclone Alfred, another part of Australia is battling the opposite conditions. Hopes that water will make its way south are evaporating fast, with experts saying conditions are too dry.

title.children: Little hope for ex-cyclone flows in NSW, Victoria and SA, experts warn

image.altText: A cow nuzzles her calf in a paddock.

props.synopsis: A calf that fell down a well near Mount Gambier is safe and healthy after a lengthy rescue operation.

title.children: Moving scenes as calf reunited with mum after falling down well

image.altText: Harvesters work side by side in a wheat field.

props.synopsis: Farmers already contend with concentrated retail markets in the form of Woolworths and Coles, and plans for Elders to acquire agribusiness competitor Delta Ag have some worried history could be repeating.

title.children: Elders merger sparks concerns of market monopoly for farmers

image.altText: A road train comes close to a head-on crash.

props.synopsis: South Australian police release footage they say shows a truck veering onto the wrong side of the road and into the path of oncoming traffic as its driver attempts to overtake another heavy vehicle near a "sweeping right-hand bend".

title.children: Truckie to face court after dash cam shows terrifying near-miss

image.altText: A woman with sunglasses on outside court next to a camera operator

props.synopsis: Raelene Polymiadis, who allegedly murdered her elderly parents by injecting them with her prescription insulin, admits to breaching bail by attending a shopping centre in Adelaide's north in December 2023.

title.children: Murder-accused Raelene Polymiadis admits to shopping centre bail breach

image.altText: A woman holds a small black and white dog

props.synopsis: Laws introduced last year aim to make it easier for tenants to have pets in private rentals in South Australia. But some say it's making little difference on the ground, as renters continue to face high levels of competition amid an ongoing housing crisis.

title.children: Concerns renters with pets are still being rejected, despite law reform

image.altText: Fatal stabbing victim William Holdback.

props.synopsis: The mother of William Holdback, who was fatally stabbed on a suburban Adelaide street almost a year ago, has expressed her devastation as the two men charged with his murder enter not guilty pleas in court.

title.children: 'Worst nightmare': mother's grief as accused men deny murder charge

image.altText: Lisa Cunningham

props.synopsis: An Australian woman awaiting trial over the death of her stepdaughter is unable to leave jail because her bail has been set at a "terribly unfair" $US500,000, according to her lawyer.

title.children: SA woman awaiting trial over stepdaughter's death can't post bail, lawyer says

image.altText: Jason Hagon is wearing a suit but no tie and walking next to a female reporter

props.synopsis: Jason Paul Hagon's six-year jail term for indecently assaulting nine female clients at his home-based business has been reduced by eight months on appeal.

title.children: Massage therapist's jail term for indecently assaulting clients reduced

image.altText: A woman with blonde hair wearing a green shirt smiling in front of rolled up carpet

props.synopsis: The South Australian was turning off a light and heading to bed when lightning struck her house and sent a bolt through her arm.

title.children: Woman struck by lightning while turning off light in her home

image.altText: A man with a beard and hat smiles at the camera.

props.synopsis: Every week, Andrew Shandley drives a 2,000km bus route to deliver one of the longest, bumpiest public transport routes in Australia.

title.children: Meet the Australians with no shop, no car, and a 100km trip to get food

image.altText: References to the nuclear component of the Coalition's energy policy were missing from statements

props.synopsis: The Coalition claims it could have struck a tariff deal with Trump but remains coy about what else it could achieve if it wins at the upcoming election.

title.children: Why claims that meeting Trump in person could sway him on tariffs are 'hollow'

image.altText: A satellite image shows clouds forming a tropical cyclone off the coast of Australia

props.synopsis: As global temperatures climb, scientists say some of the things that made Tropical Cyclone Alfred unique — such as threatening to make landfall further south than normal and causing more damage — could be a taste of the future.

title.children: Could a tropical cyclone hit Sydney one day? Here's what the science says

image.altText: A man with short fair hair wears an Australian green and white jersey while shouting and pointing at someone out of frame

props.synopsis: French authorities had issued an arrest warrant for Rocky Elsom, who faces two years in prison for his conduct while president of a French rugby club.

title.children: Rocky Elsom handed two-year jail term for misusing corporate assets

image.altText: Djawa is smiling hugging a man. He has grey hair and is wearing a checked blaxer and blue button up shirt.

props.synopsis: The High Court has confirmed that native title is property and Gumatj traditional owners should be compensated. What does it mean nationally?

title.children: Compensation for all mob after High Court decision? Legal experts explain

image.altText: Meghan holds a giggling Lilibet in the air as Harry holds Archie on his knee

props.synopsis: Being born with a House of Windsor silver spoon in your mouth brings a fairytale level of privilege and the sort of job security the rest of us can only dream of.

title.children: Is it better to be a working royal or make your own way?

image.altText: sheep in Queensland slaughterhouse

props.synopsis: A federal MP said these animal activists had "no place in our society".  Now four slaughterhouses in his electorate are under investigation for alleged animal cruelty.

title.children: Activists with secret cameras spark slaughterhouse investigation

image.altText: A happy family and their dog sitting on a mustard coloured sofa

props.synopsis: Unlike the breeders of my generation, many parents today are highly involved in their children's lives and the clear majority of them, and their children, are very happy about it.

title.children: Unlike my generation, today's parents embrace child rearing as a way of life

image.altText: A full orange moon rises behind a historic tower in a cityscape at dusk.

props.synopsis: Photos from across the world have emerged of a 'blood moon' during a rare lunar eclipse.

title.children: Pictured: Lunar eclipse 2025 from around the world

image.altText: A US influencer holding a joey wombat that is in distress with its mouth open

props.synopsis: The Department of Home Affairs says a woman who posted footage of herself taking a joey from its distressed mother left the country today.

title.children: Influencer who snatched baby wombat leaves country after visa review

image.altText: A woman with brown curly hair sits on a grey sofa, looking unwell, with her hand to her head

props.synopsis: 'Brain fog' during perimenopause is real, and it can disrupt women's lives and careers. It's one of many cognitive impacts of the transition to menopause.

title.children: The brain science of perimenopause can change everything for women

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: An elderly asian man in a blue suit sitting on a video screen

props.synopsis: Former Philippines president Rodrigo Duterte appeared at the International Criminal Court in The Hague on Friday, via videolink, where he faces murder allegations stemming from his "war on drugs".

title.children: Philippines ex-president Rodrigo Duterte appears at the Hague

image.altText: An exterior shot of Univeristy of Melbourne.

props.synopsis: The Australian government is seeking answers after universities were sent a questionnaire the tertiary education union is calling "blatant political interference".

title.children: Trump administration asks Australian universities to justify US funding

image.altText: Image of three dogs on a rock

props.synopsis: A team on Kangaroo Island is making a final push to eradicate feral cats using specially trained hounds and high-tech traps.

title.children: How three dogs could help Kangaroo Island eliminate feral cats

image.altText: Albanese situation room cyclone alfred

props.synopsis: The admission on a Perth radio station comes after the prime minister swerved questions at a Thursday press conference.

title.children: Albanese attended political fundraiser on same day as Dutton

image.altText: Lots of round cactus fronds

props.synopsis: Noxious weeds cost Australia billions of dollars each year in agricultural and environmental degradation. These weeds of national significance are among the worst.

title.children: There are 32 weeds of national significance. Here are 10 of the worst

image.altText: Jack Brabham sitting in his F1 car in 1966, wearing a helmet and driving goggles

props.synopsis: Europe's stranglehold on F1 was broken in the mid-1960s by an Australian partnership that left a legacy of excellence.

title.children: 'His greatest achievement': The Australian partnership that took down F1 establishment
